Docs.summary: Authenticates a security token using a custom authentication scheme.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Override the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class when the Windows authentication provided by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class isn't sufficient. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.WindowsUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class authenticates the user name and password in a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.UserNameSecurityToken> security token as a Windows account.
To provide a custom authentication scheme, derive a class from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNamePasswordValidator> class, implement the authentication scheme, and then pass that class to the constructor for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator> class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateUserNamePasswordCore%2A> method uses the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.UserNamePasswordValidator> passed into the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator.%23ctor%2A> constructor to authenticate the user.
When the username and password cannot be validated, throw the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenValidationException>.
When there are no authorization policies in effect for this application, return an empty <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection%601> of type <xref:System.IdentityModel.Policy.IAuthorizationPolicy>.
When `null` is returned from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Selectors.CustomUserNameSecurityTokenAuthenticator.ValidateUserNamePasswordCore%2A> method, [!INCLUDE[vsindigo](~/includes/vsindigo-md.md)] throws the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityTokenValidationException>.
